channel.title: About SkoHub
channel.description:
SkoHub – Simple Knowledge Organization Hub
[SkoHub](https://skohub.io) supports a novel approach for finding content on the web. The general idea is to extend the scope of Knowledge Organization Systems (KOS) to also act as communication hubs for publishers and information seekers. In effect, SkoHub allows to follow specific subjects in order to be notified when new content about that subject is published.

item.title: About SkoHub
item.dc:creator: acka47
item.description:
This brings me to the question: If people would collaboratively create, maintain and use a controlled taxonomy on the web, shouldn’t we call that a folksonomy?

Read full topic

item.title: About SkoHub
item.dc:creator: hamishcampbell
item.description:
will do… yep it’s an interesting subject.our project is grassroots up so based on tag folksonomy but no reason not to build something more complex on top of this.

Read full topic

item.description:
Hi Hamish, I just watched The reboot of the indymedia project - ConfTube. I also think SkoHub could be useful in the project. Will you join the SkoHub Q&A tomorrow?
